race.name: BELGIAN WAFFLE RIDE CEDAR CITY
race.tagline: High-desert suffering at altitude with red rock views and sand sectors that'll humble the strongest riders

length.explanation: At 117 miles, the Waffle course is substantial ultra-endurance territory that demands serious preparation and pacing strategy.

technicality.explanation: Rocky singletrack, sand sectors, chunky jeep roads, and 'lava slicer rocks' create a technical gauntlet. 2026 removes some singletrack but remains demanding.

elevation.explanation: 5,940 feet of climbing is moderate by mountain standards, but at altitude this feels significantly harder than the numbers suggest.

climate.explanation: June typically offers 50s-to-80s temperature swings, strong headwinds, dust, and low humidity. The 2024 edition saw snow - anything can happen.

altitude.explanation: Starting at 5,846 feet (highest BWR start), the altitude noticeably impacts power output. Flat-landers will struggle to breathe and pace effectively.

logistics.explanation: Las Vegas airport is 2.5-3 hours away, Cedar City has limited hotel inventory. Remote but manageable with advance planning.

adventure.explanation: Red rock valleys, vast plateaus, 360-degree desert views near Zion and Bryce Canyon. Epic scenery that makes the suffering worthwhile.

prestige.explanation: Part of the BWR Quad-Tripel Crown series with national recognition. Not LTGP but carries serious weight in the gravel community.

race_quality.explanation: Monuments of Cycling delivers professional production - 4 well-stocked feed zones, quality expo, and race day execution that matches the premium positioning.

experience.explanation: The high-desert suffering combined with stunning red rock terrain creates a memorable experience unlike any other gravel race in America.

community.explanation: Strong BWR series following creates a dedicated community. The Quad-Tripel Crown format builds loyalty and camaraderie among repeat participants.

field_depth.explanation: Pro-level field attracts names like Keegan Swenson, Pete Stetina, and Sofia Gomez Villafane. Strong competition without being LTGP mandatory.

value.explanation: Premium pricing for a premium event. Fair value for the production quality and experience, but not exceptional bang for buck.

expenses.explanation: 2.5-3 hour drive from Vegas, moderate hotel costs in a small town. Expect $500-1000 total for travel, lodging, and entry.

terrain.description: High altitude Utah terrain starting at 5,846 ft with 60% unroad surface. Features rocky singletrack, sand sectors, chunky jeep roads, and 'lava slicer rocks'. 2026 removes technical singletrack in favor of flowing dirt and gravel.

registration.note: Tiered pricing with early registration discounts. Quad-Tripel Crown: Buy 3 BWR events, get 4th free.

competition.seriesContext: Part of 2026 Quad-Tripel Crown of Gravel (AZ Feb, CA May, UT June, MT June)

typical.conditions: Hot days, cool mornings, very dry (26% humidity), strong winds

warnings: 2024 edition shortened due to snow, high winds, cold
UV index of 6 - high sun exposure

uniqueCharacteristics: Highest starting elevation of all BWR events (5,846 ft)
Southern Utah red rock terrain near Zion/Bryce Canyon
Sand sectors that humble unprepared riders
2026 course removes technical singletrack for flowing gravel
Part of BWR Quad-Tripel Crown series

blackPill.altitude: Your FTP is effectively 5-10% lower at this altitude. Power numbers will lie to you.
blackPill.terrain: This is NOT smooth gravel - sand sectors have ended races for riders without proper skills.
blackPill.weather: June doesn't guarantee good weather. The 2024 edition had snow.
blackPill.equipment: 40mm minimum tires, tubeless mandatory, 1:1 gearing or you'll be hiking.
blackPill.logistics: Nearest major airport is 2.5-3 hours away. Book hotels early - limited inventory.
